text: I was a beta user on LinkedIn's new services pages. I got a few messages and RFPs through, but found them largely to be spam (including one person who attempted to defraud me with a deposit check that bounced, asking for a partial refund). Now that the program's live, does anyone have similar or different experience to share? I want it to work because it's low investment to set up as a LinkedIn user, but... sigh.

text:
Hi folks! My brother is working on a new contract with a government client that he’ll need some consistent, freelance marketing support on. This position is (mostly) remote but applicants should be based in Ontario, Canada.

Here’s what he’s looking for:

- Someone to help build out documents for our gov. team about emerging tech (blockchain, AI, etc.)
- Presentation materials / Internal marketing materials
- Developing internal marketing tools
- Keep an eye on the Gartner emerging tech model to see what's coming up
- May occasionally need a business trip to Ottawa

This is consistent part-time work — shouldn’t require more than a few hours of work ~2 days a week, w/ a rate of ~$200 CAD a day. (This is ballpark since the contract is still being finalized.) If you’re interested, reach out to <mailto:eric@schedule6.com|eric@schedule6.com>.

text: Looking for writers with experience writing for reinsurance! The agency I work for is looking for someone who can write blogs and ebooks related to this niche, with a special interest in the Asian reinsurance marketplace. Please DM me writing samples and rates. Thank you!
